intro: Saurauia dicalyx, commonly known as the white-flowered saurauia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth texture. Saurauia dicalyx is often found in shaded, moist forest environments, thriving in the understory of tropical rainforests.
